title: Strange SBB behaviour
content:
I have a code in which I have:

EAX=00002c36

and after:

SBB eax, 0

the eax turns:

EAX=00002c35

Is that possible?

Shouldn't eax be the same value?

If it's correct, it seems like I don't really understand the sbb instruction. Thanks in adv

comments.text: Sbb is subtract with borrow check the carry flags
Can you give me a link to a good reference about SBB instruction and how carry flag works because there's nothing on the web and I don't want to purchase assembly books, thanks
Or, if you would be so kind and explain it to me briefly

answers_data.content:
From Google Books:

"The SBB instruction subtracts the source operand from the destination operand and subtracts 1 if the carry flag is set..."

I think this is the answer.
